00042 class GMM

00044  private:

00056  public:
00060   GMM() : gaussians(0), dimensionality(0)
00061   {
00062     // Warn the user.  They probably don't want to do this.  If this constructor
00063     // is being used (because it is required by some template classes), the user
00064     // should know that it is potentially dangerous.
00065     Log::Debug << "GMM::GMM(): no parameters given; Estimate() will fail "
00066         << "unless parameters are set." << std::endl;
00067   }
00068 
00076   GMM(size_t gaussians, size_t dimensionality) :
00077       gaussians(gaussians),
00078       dimensionality(dimensionality),
00079       means(gaussians, arma::vec(dimensionality)),
00080       covariances(gaussians, arma::mat(dimensionality, dimensionality)),
00081       weights(gaussians) { /* nothing to do */ }
00082 
00090   GMM(const std::vector<arma::vec>& means,
00091       const std::vector<arma::mat>& covariances,
00092       const arma::vec& weights) :
00093       gaussians(means.size()),
00094       dimensionality((!means.empty()) ? means[0].n_elem : 0),
00095       means(means),
00096       covariances(covariances),
00097       weights(weights) { /* nothing to do */ }
00098
